properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 4:10AM MST until February 7 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 5500 feet, heavy snow
occurring. Additional snow accumulations of mostly 8 to 15
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph in the mountains. For
the Winter Weather Advisory below 5500 feet, snow expected to
develop during the morning. Total snow accumulations of mostly 3
to 7 inches, except 1 to 3 inches in the Great Falls area.

* WHERE...Cascade and Judith Basin.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, mainly over mountain
passes, where areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning
and evening commutes. There will also be increased avalanche
danger for backcountry recreation.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will decrease somewhat this
afternoon, possibly allowing it to partially melt on lower
elevation roadways, then refreeze this evening. Snowfall will
increase again overnight, creating a greater icing hazard.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

If you must travel over mountain passes, keep an extra
flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY BELOW 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET
